abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental assessment reviews
            the Methane Gas Capture and Landfill Demonstration Project,
            which will make use of the bio-gas generated from solid
            wastes sanitary landfills, to produce electricity in
            Monterrey metropolitan area. The project is expected to
            significantly improve the environment, prevent gas
            emissions, and reduce non-renewable energy consumption.
            However, it is expected that during construction, adverse
            environmental impacts will affect air pollution as a result
            of dust, and generators' gas emissions; wastewater
            discharges; and, eventually, oil spillage following the
            installation of power generators; fire hazards; and, noise
            disturbances. Mitigating measures suggest: 1) In accordance
            with the country's environmental regulations, a burner
            will be installed to eliminate exceeding bio-gas emissions,
            and construction surfaces will be sprayed, maintaining an
            adequate humidity to prevent dusting. 2) Wastewater
            discharges will be controlled in accordance to standard
            regulations, and solid wastes will be disposed of at
            selected sanitary landfill sites, or recycled following the
            appropriate sanitary treatment. Similarly, oil spills will
            be stored, to be transported to pre-selected sites for final
            disposal. 3) A methane detector will be installed to prevent
            flammable gas concentrations, and potential fire hazards. 4)
            Wall barriers will be installed, and protective equipment
            available to mitigate noise disturbances. It is further
            recommended that trees be planted around the construction
            area, to minimize noise, and air pollution.
